byline.contributor: Amy Chozick contributed reporting from Cleveland, Thomas Kaplan from Pittsburgh, and Yamiche Alcindor from Lebanon, N.H.

abstract: Presidential candidates Hillary Clinton and Donald J Trump spend Labor Day wooing Ohio voters as they prepare for unconventional campaign's final weeks; visits to Ohio by Trump and Clinton, along with their respective running mates Indiana Gov Mike Pence and Sen Tim Kaine, highlight importance of winning state.
lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton returned to the trail on Monday after a summer of fund-raising, while Mr. Trump went to Ohio to begin a week of swing-state campaigning.
snippet: Mrs. Clinton returned to the trail on Monday after a summer of fund-raising, while Mr. Trump went to Ohio to begin a week of swing-state campaigning....

headline.main: On Labor Day, Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton Begin a Final Sprint
headline.print_headline: Trump and Clinton Begin Final Sprint to November
